translation: Second Fascicle of the Sutra of the Great Decease

source_sentence: 東晉平陽沙門釋法顯譯
translation: Translated by Shi Faxian, an ascetic of Pingyang in the Eastern Jin dynasty

source_sentence: 「爾時，雪山有八萬四千白象，日日來到，列王殿前。
translation: "At the time, 84,000 white elephants came from the snowy mountains day after day and lined up in front of the king's palace.

source_sentence: 時，王心念：『此諸白象恒來我所，經由道路，踐踖眾生。』
translation: The king then thought to himself, 'These white elephants are always coming to me, passing through the roads and trampling over sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 即便勅語主兵臣言：『自今已後，不須此象日來我所，經一千歲可令一來，但令四萬二千便足，不必其滿八萬四千。』
translation: I then commanded the commanding officer to tell the ministers, 'From now on, I don't need these elephants to come to me every day; I can make one come after 1,000 years, but 42,000 will suffice; there's no need for them to complete 84,000.'

source_sentence: 王玉女寶，名曰善賢，與餘夫人及以婇女八萬四千人，於靜室中坐禪思惟，經四萬歲，共相謂言：『我等在此坐禪思惟經四萬歲，不見大王，今者宜應禮拜問訊。』
translation: The king's jeweled lady, named Shanxian, and the other ladies and 84,000 of their daughters were sitting in a quiet room, meditating and reflecting for 40,000 years, and they all said to each other, 'We haven't seen the king for 40,000 years while we've been sitting here meditating and reflecting, so now we should pay our respects and ask about him.'

source_sentence: 作此言已，即便相隨，到於王所。
translation: After they said this, they even followed each other to the king's residence.

source_sentence: 其餘宮人，入白王言：『善賢今與八萬四千女人，來問訊王。』
translation: The rest of the palace guards went in and said to the king, 'Good man, now you and 84,000 women have come to greet the king.'

source_sentence: 時王聞已，即便往於說法殿上，昇師子座。
translation: After the king heard this, he went up to the Dharma talk hall and ascended to the lion's seat.

source_sentence: 俄爾之頃，善賢等至，王即喚前。
translation: Just then, Good Samaritan and the others arrived, and the king called them forward.

source_sentence: 時，善賢等相隨而進，到於王所，頭面禮足，次第而坐，即作是言：『我等共在靜室之中，坐禪思惟經四萬歲，不見王久，故來問訊，欲有所說，唯願聽許。』
translation: They then followed him and went up to the king, paid homage with their heads and feet, and sat down one by one, saying, 'We've been sitting in a quiet room together, meditating and contemplating for 40,000 years, but we haven't seen the king for a long time, so we've come to ask about something we want to tell him.

source_sentence: 王即答言：『善哉！
translation: The king then answered, 'Good!

source_sentence: 隨意。』
translation: As you wish.'

source_sentence: 善賢即便而白王言：『此閻浮提，西瞿耶尼，北欝單越，東弗婆提，四方人民極為熾盛，富樂安隱，皆行十善，竝是大王德化力也。
translation: Even then, Good Samaritan said to the king, 'This Yambudvīpa, Ghoṣinī to the west, Uttarakuru to the north, and Pūrvavide to the east, the people in the four directions are extremely prosperous, wealthy, happy, and peaceful, and they all practice the ten good qualities because of the great king's virtuous transformation power.

source_sentence: 此閻浮提，如鳩尸婆帝城者，其數凡有八萬四千，此諸城等，國王臣民及婆羅門，皆悉來此，欲見大王。
translation: There are 84,000 of these cities in Jambudvīpa, such as Kauśīpatī, and the king's subjects and Brahmans have all come here to see the great king.

source_sentence: 而王坐禪經多年歲，來朝謁者皆不相見，譬如孝子不見慈父。
translation: After years of sitting in meditation, the king's courtiers didn't meet him, like a filial son who doesn't see his loving father.

source_sentence: 又四天下，不見大王遊歷甚久，唯願大王，善將時宜，撫接民人。
translation: We haven't seen the king travel around the four continents for a long time, so we hope the king will make good use of the time and nurture the people.

source_sentence: 我等女弱，於國無益，所以坐禪適意久遠。
translation: We women are weak and useless to the country, so we've been sitting in meditation for a long time.

source_sentence: 大王處貴統攝內外，一切人民莫不宗仰，豈得如我女人所行。
translation: The great king's position is so noble that he subsumes both internal and external, and all the people look up to him, so how could he do what we women do?

source_sentence: 白象車馬，其數各有八萬四千，大王宜應乘之遊觀。
translation: There are 84,000 white elephants, chariots, and horses, so it's appropriate for the king to ride them around and look at them.

source_sentence: 大王昔日，恒為一切說種種法，授以十善，頃來坐禪斯事頓廢。』
translation: In the past, the great king always taught various things to all people and gave them the ten good qualities, but in a while now, this kind of meditation has suddenly become obsolete.'

source_sentence: 于時，善賢以如此事，種種諫王。
translation: At the time, Good Samaritan was remonstrating with the king about these things.

source_sentence: 大善見王聞此語已，而答之言：『汝於前後每以善事而諫勸我，今聞汝言，殊乖昔意。』
translation: After hearing this, the king replied, 'You've always advised me on good matters in the past and in the future, but now that I've heard what you've said, it's not what I had intended in the past.'

source_sentence: 爾時，善賢聞王此誨，心生懊惱，垂涕念言：『我向所以諫大王者，正以所見，謂為得中，不圖乃復更生罪咎。』
translation: It was then that Shanxi heard this instruction from the king, became distressed, and hung his head in tears as he thought, 'That's precisely why I had advised the king, because I had seen it and thought it would be a success; I didn't intend for it to be a further offense.'

source_sentence: 即從座起頂禮王足，而白王言：『今我愚癡不識正理，乃以此事而用上諫，唯願大王，聽我懺悔。』
translation: He then rose from his seat and bowed his head at the king's feet and said to him, 'Now, I was foolish and didn't know the right principle, and I've used this as a reason to remonstrate with you, so please, Your Majesty, listen to my repentance.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，大善見王答善賢言：『一切諸行皆悉無常，恩愛合會亦復別離，此四天下雖爾熾盛，我亦不久當捨棄之。
translation: "It was then that the king of great good views answered Goodness, 'All conditioned things are impermanent, and even though they combine and separate affection, I will soon abandon these four worlds even though they are so prosperous.

source_sentence: 我於往昔八萬四千歲而為嬰兒，八萬四千歲而為童子，八萬四千歲為灌頂太子，八萬四千歲為灌頂王，然後得成轉輪聖王。
translation: In the past, I was 84,000 years old as a baby, 84,000 years old as a boy, 84,000 years old as a crown prince, 84,000 years old as a crowned king, and then I became a wheel-turning sage king.

source_sentence: 領四天下七寶具足，八萬四千歲統理民務，八萬四千歲為諸人民講說諸法，八萬四千歲坐禪思惟。
translation: He leads the four worlds with an abundance of seven treasures, manages the people's affairs at 84,000 years old, lectures on the Dharma for the people at 84,000 years old, and sits in meditation and contemplates at 84,000 years old.

source_sentence: 從爾已來，五十八萬八千歲，雖復如此壽命延長，會歸於盡。
translation: From then on, 58,800 years have passed since then, and even though my life has been prolonged like this, it will come to an end.

source_sentence: 我今已老，死時將至，古昔諸王尊貴快樂，如我不異，亦復遷謝歸於無常。
translation: Now that I've grown old and the time of my death is approaching, the venerable and happy kings of yore, like myself and no different, will also pass away and return to impermanence.

source_sentence: 鳩尸婆帝城，及餘八萬四千大城會亦磨滅，不應於此獨生愛著，長放逸心。
translation: Kushīpatī and the 84,000 other great cities will also perish, so I shouldn't become attached to them alone and grow careless.

source_sentence: 我今所以獲此尊勝，皆由往昔積諸善業，今者宜應廣植諸善造來生因，是故坐禪經積年歲。』
translation: I gained this honor because of the good actions I've accumulated in the past, so now I should plant goodness in abundance to create causes for future birth; therefore, I've been sitting in meditation for years and years.'

source_sentence: 爾時，善賢等聞王此言，心大歡喜，頂禮王足，退還所住。
translation: Hearing these words from the king, that group of good men rejoiced greatly, bowed their heads at the king's feet, and withdrew to their lodging.

source_sentence: 如是不久王得篤疾，自知命盡，即立太子而以為王，集餘大臣及婆羅門長者居士，以四海水灌太子頂，事既畢竟，王即命終，上生梵天。
translation: Not long after that, the king became seriously ill and knew his life was over. He made the crown prince king and gathered the other ministers and the elders and priests of the Brahmins to pour four rivers of water over the crown prince's head.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 大善見王，王四天下而其所居，唯閻浮提。
translation: "The great King of Good Visions is the king of four worlds, and the only place he lives is Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 大城雖有八萬四千，而其所處，唯鳩尸婆帝。
translation: Although there are 84,000 great cities, the only one they occupy is Kauśīmbati.

source_sentence: 雪山之中有八萬四千白象之寶，而王所乘，不過一象。
translation: There are 84,000 white elephant treasures in the snowy mountains, but the king rides on no more than one elephant.

source_sentence: 雖有八萬四千駿馬，而王所騎，不過一匹。
translation: Although there are 84,000 brave horses, the king rides no more than one horse.

source_sentence: 雖有八萬四千七寶之車，而王常駕，不過一乘。
translation: Although there are 84,000 chariots made of seven treasures, the king always drives no more than one chariot.

source_sentence: 雖有八萬四千夫人，王之所愛，唯在一人。
translation: Although there are 84,000 wives, the king loves only one of them.

source_sentence: 雕飾寶殿，八萬四千，王之所處不過一室。
translation: There are 84,000 carved and decorated jeweled palaces, but the king lives in no more than one room.

source_sentence: 身之所須，飽足而已，而王役慮四方，纏心物務，徒勞精神，於身無益。
translation: His body needs only enough to satisfy itself, but the king's efforts to think about the four directions and his preoccupation with things are fruitless and useless to his body.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 大善見王，豈異人乎？
translation: Is the king of great good views a different person?

source_sentence: 我身是也。
translation: "This is my body.

source_sentence: 我於往昔獲此尊貴，所居國城即在於此，我於此城作轉輪王，不可稱數，成就利益無量眾生。
translation: I was honored in the past and lived in the same country whose city was here, and I've been a wheel-turning king in this city for an indescribable number of years, achieving the benefit of measureless sentient beings.

source_sentence: 今者諸天充滿虛空，皆是我昔為王之時，以諸善法教化所成，其於今日復在此城，見般涅槃，當令其獲般涅槃果。
translation: The gods that fill the sky today were all created by the good things I taught and taught them when I was king, and now that they're here in this city again and see parinirvāṇa, I will cause them to attain the fruit of parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 以是事故，汝云何言此鳩尸那城為邊狹耶？
translation: For this reason, why do you say that this city of Kauśinagara is limited?

source_sentence: 我今決定住於此城而般涅槃。」
translation: Now, I'm definitely going to stay in this city and [attain] parinirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 當於如來說此事時，諸天及人億那由他，於諸法中遠塵離垢得法眼淨，即共同聲而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: When the Tathāgata spoke about this, the gods and humans, who were far removed from the dust and defilement of all dharmas and had attained purification of the Dharma eye, spoke together and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 往昔無量無邊阿僧祇劫，以諸善法利益我等，今又於此以般涅槃樂安立於我。」
translation: In the past, there were measureless and limitless incalculable eons when we were benefited by all the good qualities, and now I've been established here with the joy of parinirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 即散名華，并作天樂，歌唄讚歎，供養如來。
translation: He then scattered flowers, created celestial music, sang praises, and made offerings to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難而白佛言：「奇哉！
translation: It was then that Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Amazing!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此鳩尸那城，過去乃有斯奇特事，我今不復生小心也。」
translation: This city of Kauśinagara used to have such extraordinary features that I won't be careful anymore."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告阿難言：「汝今可入鳩尸那城語諸力士道，我今日於後夜分入般涅槃，皆悉令來與我相見，若有所疑，恣意請問，莫令於我般涅槃時不及相見後生悔恨。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Ānanda, "Now, you can go into Kauśinagara and tell the warriors that I'll enter parinirvāṇa at the latter part of the night today, so all of them will come to see me, and if they have any doubts, they'll freely ask questions, so they won't regret not seeing me when I'm in parinirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難聞佛言已，埀泣懊惱，頂禮佛足，攝身威儀，與一比丘俱共入城。
translation: After hearing what the Buddha said, Ānanda wept and was distressed, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, collected himself with dignity, and entered the city with a monk.

source_sentence: 時，鳩尸那城，諸力士等，男女大小，始共集聚，論敘如來當般涅槃，各各皆欲往詣佛所。
translation: At the time, there were soldiers and other strong men, women, and children in Kauśinagara who had first gathered to discuss the Tathāgata's future parinirvāṇa, and each wanted to go to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 會見阿難，即便問言：「我聞世尊在雙樹間將般涅槃，正共言論欲至佛所。」
translation: When they met, Ānanda even asked, "I've heard that the Bhagavān is about to [enter] parinirvāṇa among the twin trees and is talking together about wanting to go to the Buddha."

source_sentence: 於是阿難具以如來所勅之辭，告諸力士。
translation: Ānanda then told the strong men exactly what the Tathāgata had commanded him to say.

source_sentence: 力士聞已，悲號懊惱，悶絕躃地，互共微聲而相謂言：「嗚呼！
translation: After hearing this, the strong men wailed in pity and distress, fell to the ground in despair, and said to each other in a small voice, "Whoops!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 世間眼滅，我等從今何所歸依？
translation: Where do we take refuge now that the eye of the world has ceased?

source_sentence: 猶如嬰兒失於慈母，從今已去，人天轉減，三惡道趣日就增盛。」
translation: They're like a baby who loses its loving mother; from now on, humans and gods will decrease, and the three bad destinies will increase day by day."

source_sentence: 白阿難言：「我等眷屬，今欲相隨往至佛所。」
translation: He said to Ānanda, "We, his followers, would like to accompany him to the Buddha's place now."

source_sentence: 是時阿難還白佛言，以世尊語入城宣示。
translation: Ānanda then returned to the Buddha and said, 'Let's go into the city and tell him what the Bhagavān said.'

source_sentence: 諸力士眾莫不驚絕涕泣歔欷，皆悉當來瞻奉世尊。
translation: The multitude of strong men were all startled, weeping, and lamenting, and they all came to revere the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 諸力士等，男女大小，一切相隨，流淚嗚咽，緣路而進。
translation: The soldiers, both men and women, large and small, all followed along, weeping and sobbing, and they all made their way along the path.

source_sentence: 是時，阿難見諸力士人數甚多，心自念言：「若此人眾，一一禮佛無有竟時。
translation: When Ānanda saw how numerous the strong men were, he thought to himself, "There's no end to the time when each of these people would venerate the Buddha.

source_sentence: 我今當令家家一時禮。」
translation: Now, I will make each of them venerate the Buddha at once."

source_sentence: 諸力士眾至佛所已，阿難即便普語之言：「汝等來眾既為不少，若人人禮佛不卒得竟。
translation: When the multitude of strong men arrived at the Buddha, Ānanda said to them universally, "Since you've come in such large numbers, it wouldn't be possible for everyone to finish worshipping the Buddha.

source_sentence: 今可家家一時禮也。」
translation: Now, you can venerate each family at once."

source_sentence: 力士奉旨即便禮佛，退住一面，而白佛言：「唯願世尊！
translation: Following the order, the strong men then paid homage to the Buddha, withdrew to one side, and said to the Buddha, "May it please the Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 住壽一劫！
translation: (Skt. Sumeru Ikaruga)!

source_sentence: 若減一劫，不般涅槃！
translation: If you subtract one eon, you won't attain parinirvāṇa!

source_sentence: 利益一切諸天人民，今諸眾生無有慧眼。
translation: "To the benefit of all the gods and peoples, sentient beings today lack the eye of insight.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊！
translation: May it be, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為作開導。」
translation: To guide," he said.

source_sentence: 爾時，如來告力士言：「汝今不應作此請我。
translation: It was then that the Tathāgata addressed Rāṣṭrapāla, "You shouldn't be inviting me to do this now.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 一切諸行皆悉無常，恩愛合會必歸別離。
translation: All conditioned phenomena are impermanent, and the union of affection must lead to separation.

source_sentence: 設我住世，若滿一劫，會亦當滅。
translation: If I were to remain in the world for an eon, the union would also cease.

source_sentence: 我所說法但當憶持誦念勿忘，此則不異我在世也。」
translation: My teaching should be recollected, memorized, and not forgotten, and then it wouldn't be different from my presence in the world."

source_sentence: 諸力士等聞佛此言，不果所請，心懷愁悴，悲泣懊惱，默然而住。
translation: When the warriors and others heard what the Buddha said, they were unsuccessful in their requests, were sad and weary, lamented and distressed, and stayed in silence.

source_sentence: 爾時，鳩尸那城有一外道，年百二十，名須跋陀羅，聰明多智，誦四毘陀經，一切書論無不通達，為一切人之所宗敬。
translation: At the time, there was a layman named Subhadra in Kuśinagara city who was 120 years old, intelligent and resourceful, recited the four Vedas, had no knowledge of all writings and discussions, and was held in high esteem by all people.

source_sentence: 其聞如來在娑羅林雙樹之間將般涅槃，心自思惟：「我諸書論，說佛出世極為難遇，如優曇鉢花時一現耳。
translation: When he heard that the Tathāgata was about to [enter] parinirvāṇa between two trees in the Śāla Forest, he thought to himself, "My writings and treatises say that the Buddha's appearance in the world is extremely difficult to encounter, like the once-in-a-lifetime appearance of the udumbara flower.

source_sentence: 其今在於娑羅林中，我有所疑，試往請問，瞿曇若能決我疑者，便是實得一切種智。」
translation: Now, while he's here in the Śālavana Grove, I have some doubts, so I'd like to go there and ask Gautama if he can answer my doubts, then I've really attained omniscience."

source_sentence: 作此念已，往到佛所，在於林外，逢見阿難，即語之言：「我書論中說佛興世極難值遇，億千萬劫時時乃出，如優曇鉢華不可數覩，在世教化，我初不見，今聞在此娑羅林中當般涅槃，我有所疑，欲往請問。
translation: After he had this thought, he went to the Buddha and met Ānanda outside the grove. He said, "My writings and the treatises say that buddhas arise in the world and are extremely difficult to encounter, appearing only once every hundred million eons like the incalculable udumbara flower and teaching in the world, but I hadn't seen them before.

source_sentence: 汝可為我白世尊言，道我今者欲希相見。」
translation: You can tell the Bhagavān for me, saying, 'Now, I'd like to meet you.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難聞其此語，心自思惟：「世尊今者四大不和，接對來久，已自增惡。
translation: Hearing this, Ānanda thought to himself, "The Bhagavān's four elements aren't in harmony now, and they've been in contact with each other for a long time, which has already increased their own badness.

source_sentence: 若復與此外道相見，必有言論，容致損劇。」
translation: If we were to meet with another person, there would surely be words that would cause harm."

source_sentence: 即答之言：「世尊今者四大不和，寢臥林中極苦身痛，汝今不須見如來也，莫臨世尊般涅槃時而作障礙。」
translation: He replied, "Now, the Bhagavān's four elements are out of harmony, and he's lying in the forest suffering terribly, so you don't need to see the Tathāgata now; don't be an obstruction when he approaches parinirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅如是三請，阿難亦復如是三答。
translation: Subhadra thus requested this three times, and Ānanda likewise answered these three times.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊以淨天耳，聞須跋陀羅請阿難聲，又觀其根，是可度時，即以梵音告阿難言：「汝莫於我最後弟子獨作留礙，聽須跋陀羅前來，我欲見之。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān, with the pure divine ear, heard Suppatra's voice inviting Ānanda to come, and when he examined his faculties and realized that he could be saved, he addressed Ānanda in a Brahmā voice, saying, "Don't be an obstruction to my last disciple alone; listen to Suppatra as he comes forward, for I want to see him.

source_sentence: 此人質直聰慧易悟，所以求進欲決疑難，非為故來論勝負也。」
translation: This man is straightforward, intelligent, and easily enlightened, so he seeks to advance and resolve doubts and difficulties, not for the sake of discussing victory or defeat."

source_sentence: 於是阿難即承佛教，語須跋陀羅：「世尊今已勅聽汝前。」
translation: Ānanda then acknowledged the Buddha's teaching and said to Śubhadra, "The Bhagavān has now commanded you to come forward."

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅聞佛許前，歡喜踊躍，不能自勝，而心念言：「沙門瞿曇，決定是得一切種智。」
translation: When Subhadra heard that the Buddha had given his approval, he rejoiced and jumped for joy, unable to overcome himself, and said to himself, "Gautama the ascetic, this is certainly the attainment of omniscience."

source_sentence: 即前佛所，互相問訊坐於一面，而白佛言：「瞿曇，欲有所問，唯願聽許。」
translation: He went to the Buddha, exchanged greetings with one another, sat to one side, and said to the Buddha, "Gautama, I'd like to ask a question, but I beg you to grant it."

source_sentence: 佛言：「善哉！
translation: The Buddha said, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅，恣汝所問。」
translation: Suppatra, grant us your question."

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅即問佛言：「今者世間沙門婆羅門外道六師、富蘭那迦葉、末伽利拘賒梨子，刪闍夜毘羅眡子、阿耆多翅舍欽婆羅、迦羅鳩駄迦旃延、尼犍陀若提子等，各各自說，是一切智，以餘學者，名為邪見。
translation: Suppatra then asked the Buddha, "Nowadays, the six ascetics, Brahmans, non-Buddhists, Pūraṇa-kāśyapa, Maudgalyāyana Kāśyapa, Sañjayī-vṛtti, Ajita-jīvajñānapāla, Kakuda-kātyāyana, and Nirgrantha-jñāniputra each teach that this is omniscience, and those who learn from others are called wrong viewers.

source_sentence: 言其所行，是解脫道，說他行者，是生死因。
translation: They say what they do is the path to liberation, and they say what others do is the cause of birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 互相是非，云何而得知其虛實？
translation: How can we know what's false and what's real when they're right and wrong?

source_sentence: 何師應得沙門之稱？
translation: What teacher deserves the title of ascetic?

source_sentence: 何師定是解脫之因？」
translation: What teacher is definitely the cause of liberation?"

source_sentence: 爾時，如來即答之曰：「善哉！
translation: At that point, the Tathāgata answered, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅，乃能問我如此之義。
translation: Subhadra, you were able to ask me about this meaning.

source_sentence: 諦聽諦聽，吾為汝說。
translation: Listen closely, listen closely, and I'll explain it for you.

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅！
translation: Subhadra!

source_sentence: 諸法之中若不見有八聖道法，當知無有一沙門名，二及三四，亦復不有；既無沙門，亦無解脫；解脫既無，非一切種智。
translation: "If you don't see the teaching of the eightfold noble path among all dharmas, you should know that there's not a single ascetic by that name, nor are there two, three, or four; since there are no ascetics, there's no liberation; and since liberation is absent, it's not omniscience.

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅！
translation: Subhadra!

source_sentence: 若諸法中，有八聖道法，當知必有四沙門名；有沙門名，則有解脫；既有解脫，是一切種智。
translation: "If there are eight noble paths among dharmas, you should know that there must be four ascetics who are called ascetics, and if there are ascetics, then there's liberation; and if there's liberation, then this is the knowledge of all kinds.

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅！
translation: Subhadra!

source_sentence: 唯我法中，有八聖道，有四沙門名，是解脫道，是一切種智。
translation: "Only in my teaching are there the eight noble paths and four ascetic names, which are the path to liberation and the cognition of all distinctive qualities.

source_sentence: 彼諸外道，富蘭那迦葉等，其說法中，無八聖道，無沙門名，非是解脫及一切種智。
translation: Those non-Buddhists, Pūraṇa-kāśyapa and others, say that there are no eight noble paths or ascetic names in the Dharma, and they aren't liberation or the knowledge of all kinds.

source_sentence: 若言有者，當知必是虛誑之說。
translation: If they say they do, you should know that they must be speaking falsely.

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅！
translation: Subhadra!

source_sentence: 一切眾生，聞我所說，信受思惟，當知其人必不空聞要得解脫。
translation: "All sentient beings who hear what I've taught and believe and contemplate it should know that they will surely attain liberation without hearing about it in vain.

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅！
translation: Subhadra!

source_sentence: 我在王宮未出家時，一切世間皆為六師之所迷醉，初未見有沙門之實。
translation: When I was in the palace and hadn't left home, the whole world was intoxicated by the six teachers, and I hadn't seen the true nature of ascetics for the first time.

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅！
translation: Subhadra!

source_sentence: 我年二十有九，出家學道，三十有六，於菩提樹下，思八聖道究竟源底，成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，得一切種智。
translation: I was twenty years old and nine years old when I left home to train on the path and thirty years old and six years old when, under the bodhi tree, I contemplated the ultimate source of the eight noble paths, became unsurpassed, completely enlightened, and attained the knowledge of all kinds.

source_sentence: 即往波羅捺國鹿野苑中仙人住處，為阿若憍陳如等五人，轉四諦法輪，其得道跡。
translation: He then went to the abode of the sages in the Deer Preserve of Vārāṇasī to turn the wheel of the Dharma of the four truths for five people, including Ājñāta-Kauṇḍinya, and they showed the steps of their attainment of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 爾時始有沙門之稱，出於世間福利眾生。
translation: It was then that they first came to be known as ascetics, who went out into the world to bring benefit to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅！
translation: Subhadra!

source_sentence: 當知我法能得解脫，如來實是一切種智。」
translation: You should know that my teaching leads to liberation and that the Tathāgata really does have omniscience."

source_sentence: 爾時，須跋陀羅，既聞如來說八聖道，心生歡喜，舉身毛竪，渴仰欲聞八聖道義，而白佛言：「唯願世尊！
translation: It was then that Subhadra, having heard the Tathāgata preach about the eight noble paths, rejoiced, raised his body's hair, longed to hear the meaning of the eight noble paths, and said to the Buddha, "May it please the Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為我分別八聖道義。」
translation: Discern for me the meaning of the eightfold noble path."

source_sentence: 於是世尊即便為其分別廣說。
translation: The Bhagavān then proceeded to discern and explain them in detail for him.

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅既聞佛說八聖道義，心意開朗，豁然大悟，於諸法中遠塵離垢得法眼淨，即白佛言：「我今欲於佛法出家。」
translation: After hearing the Buddha's explanation of the eight noble paths, Subhadra's mind was enlightened and he attained a sudden, great awakening, which made him far removed from the dust and defilement of all dharmas and purified the Dharma eye.

source_sentence: 於是世尊即便喚之：「善來！
translation: The Bhagavān then called out to him, "Well come!

source_sentence: 比丘！」
translation: bhikṣu!"

source_sentence: 鬚髮自落，袈裟著身，即成沙門。
translation: With his beard and hair falling out, he puts his robe around him and becomes an ascetic.

source_sentence: 世尊又為廣說四諦，即獲漏盡，成阿羅漢。
translation: The Bhagavān also explained the four truths in detail, and he attained the end of the contaminants and became an arhat.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告阿難言：「汝今當知，我於道場，成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed Ānanda, "Now, you should know that I have accomplished unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment while on the path.

source_sentence: 最初說法，度阿若憍陳如等五人。
translation: At first, I taught the Dharma and delivered the Dharma to five people, including Ājñāta-Kauṇḍinya.

source_sentence: 今日在於娑羅林中，臨般涅槃，最後說法，度須跋陀羅。
translation: Today, in the Śāla Forest, I'm approaching parinirvāṇa, and I'm finally teaching the Dharma and liberating Subhadra.

source_sentence: 諸天及人，無復更應聞我說法而得度者；若有善根應得解脫，當來皆是我之弟子，展轉相教。
translation: There's no one among gods or humans who should hear my teaching and be saved; if they have good roots and should attain liberation, they'll all be my disciples in the future, and they'll continue to teach each other.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅雖是外道，而其善根，應成熟時，唯有如來，能分別知。
translation: Although Subhadra is a heretic, when his good roots mature, only the Tathāgata can discern them.

source_sentence: 我般涅槃後，若有外道，欲於我法求出家者，汝等不應便聽許之。
translation: If, after I attain parinirvāṇa, a layman wants to leave home because of my teaching, you shouldn't just listen and allow him.

source_sentence: 先令四月誦習經典，觀其意性為虛為實，若見其行質直柔軟，於我法中實有深樂，然後方可聽其出家。
translation: First, you should make them recite the sūtras for four months and examine their intentions, whether they're false or real, and then listen to them as renunciants only if you see that their conduct is straightforward and gentle and that they really have deep joy in our teaching.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 所以然者，汝等小智，不能分別眾生之根，是故令汝先觀之耳。」
translation: That's why you have been instructed to examine it first because you have little wisdom that can't discern the faculties of sentient beings."

source_sentence: 爾時，須跋陀羅而白佛言：「我於向者，欲求出家。
translation: It was then that Subhadra said to the Buddha, "In the past, I wanted to leave home.

source_sentence: 世尊若令先於佛法四十年中讚誦經典，然後聽我而出家者，我亦能爾！
translation: Bhagavān, if you would allow me to recite the sūtras during the forty years of the Buddha's teachings and then listen to me and leave home, I could do that, too!

source_sentence: 豈況四月？」
translation: How could it be in April?"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即告之言：「如是，如是！
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān addressed them, saying, "So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 須跋陀羅！
translation: Subhadra!

source_sentence: 我觀汝意，於我法中慇懃渴仰，今作此言，非為虛設。」
translation: I've observed your intention and longing for my teaching, and now you're saying this, and it's not a false assumption."

source_sentence: 爾時，須跋陀羅前白佛言：「我今不忍見天人尊入般涅槃，我於今日，欲先世尊入般涅槃。」
translation: It was then that Subhadra went forward and said to the Buddha, "Now, I can't bear to see the gods and humans enter parinirvāṇa; today, I want to precede the Bhagavān into parinirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 佛言：「善哉。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Good."

source_sentence: 時，須跋陀羅，即於佛前，入火界三昧而般涅槃。
translation: Subhadra then, directly before the Buddha, entered the fire concentration and passed into parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 爾時，如來告阿難言：「汝勿見我入般涅槃，便謂正法於此永絕。
translation: It was then that the Tathāgata addressed Ānanda, "Don't look at me entering parinirvāṇa and say that the right teaching has been permanently extinguished here.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我昔為諸比丘，制戒波羅提木叉，及餘所說種種妙法，此即便是汝等大師。
translation: This was your great teacher, even though I used to prescribe precepts for monks, the prātimokṣa, and various other wonderful things that I taught.

source_sentence: 如我在世，無有異也。
translation: As I was in the world, there's no difference.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我般涅槃後，諸比丘等，各依次第，大小相敬，不得呼姓，皆喚名字。
translation: After I attain parinirvāṇa, the monks will each follow the order of precedence, respect each other as great and small, and not call each other by name.

source_sentence: 互相伺察，無令眾中有犯大戒，不應[門@視]求覓他細過。
translation: They should examine each other, so that no one in the assembly violates the great precepts and doesn't [gate@vision] seek out the minor faults of others.

source_sentence: 車匿比丘，應與重罰。」
translation: The monk Chandaka should be given a heavy punishment."

source_sentence: 阿難問佛：「與何重罰？」
translation: Ānanda asked the Buddha, "What heavy punishment should be meted out?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「阿難！
translation: The Buddha said, "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 與重罰者，一切比丘勿與共語。」
translation: If you are to be severely punished, all monks must not speak with one another."

source_sentence: 於是阿難，如教奉行。
translation: Ānanda then did as he was taught.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘：「汝等今者若有疑難，恣意請問，莫我滅後生悔恨言：『如來近在娑羅林中，我於爾時，不往諮決，致令今日情有所滯。』
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "If you have any doubts or questions today, feel free to ask them, so that you don't become remorseful after I've ceased, saying, 'The Tathāgata is near in the Śālavana forest, and I didn't go to him for a consultation at that point, which has caused my feelings to be disturbed today.'

source_sentence: 我今雖復身體有疾，猶堪為汝等解釋疑惑。
translation: Now, even though I'm physically ill, I can still explain your doubts and confusions to you.

source_sentence: 若欲於我般涅槃後奉持正法利益天人，今宜速來決所疑也。」
translation: If you want to uphold the right teaching and benefit gods and humans after my parinirvāṇa, you should quickly come now to resolve your doubts.'"

source_sentence: 世尊乃至如是三告，諸比丘等默然無有求決疑者。
translation: The Bhagavān told them this three times, but the monks remained silent, and none of them asked for a solution to their doubts.

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難即白佛言：「奇哉世尊！
translation: It was then that Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Amazing, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是三誨，而此眾中無有疑者。」
translation: So it is with these three teachings, and there's no one among this congregation who doubts them."

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是，如是。
translation: The Buddha said, "So it is, so it is.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 今此眾中，五百比丘，未得道者，我般涅槃後，未來世中，當得盡漏。
translation: Now, of the 500 monks in this congregation who haven't yet attained the way, I will end the contamination in a future life after I attain parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 汝亦當在此中數也。」
translation: You, too, will be among this number."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘：「汝等若見我身、口、意脫相犯觸，汝當語我。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "If you see my body, speech, and mind in violation of contact, you must tell me."

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘聞佛此語，流淚懊惱而白佛言：「如來豈當有身口意微細過耶？」
translation: When the monks heard this from the Buddha, they wept and were distressed as they said to him, "Could the Tathāgata have subtle faults of body, speech, and thought?"

source_sentence: 於是如來即便說偈：「諸行無常，　　是生滅法，　生滅滅已，　　寂滅為樂。」
translation: The Tathāgata then even spoke a verse, "Actions are impermanent, which are things that arise and cease, and after arising and ceasing, tranquility is bliss."

source_sentence: 爾時，如來說此偈已，告諸比丘：「汝等當知，一切諸行，皆悉無常。
translation: After speaking this verse, the Tathāgata addressed the monks, "You should know that all things that are conditioned are impermanent.

source_sentence: 我今雖是金剛之體，亦復不免無常所遷。
translation: Even though I am now the adamantine body, I'm not exempt from being subject to impermanence.

source_sentence: 生死之中極為可畏，汝等宜應勤行精進，速求離此生死火坑。
translation: The midst of birth-and-death is extremely frightening, so you should diligently conduct yourselves with energy and quickly seek to leave this fiery pit of birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 此則是我最後教也。
translation: This, then, is my final teaching.

source_sentence: 我般涅槃，其時已至。」
translation: The time has come for me to [enter] parinirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘及餘天人，聞佛此誨，悲號涕泣，悶絕躃地。
translation: When the monks and the other gods heard this teaching from the Buddha, they cried out in pity and sobbed, and they fell to the ground in despair.

source_sentence: 如來即便普告之言：「汝等不應生此悲惱，諸行性相，皆悉如是。」
translation: The Tathāgata then addressed them all, "You shouldn't be so sad and troubled; the nature and characteristics of all conditioned things are likewise."

source_sentence: 於是如來，即入初禪。
translation: The Tathāgata then entered the first dhyāna.

source_sentence: 出於初禪，入第二禪。
translation: He left the first dhyāna and entered the second dhyāna.

source_sentence: 出於二禪，入第三禪。
translation: He left the second dhyāna and entered the third dhyāna.

source_sentence: 出於三禪，入第四禪。
translation: He leaves the third dhyāna and enters the fourth dhyāna.

source_sentence: 出第四禪，入於空處。
translation: Emerging from the fourth dhyāna, he enters the abode of emptiness.

source_sentence: 出於空處，入於識處。
translation: Emerging from the abode of emptiness, he enters the abode of consciousness.

source_sentence: 出於識處，入無所有處。
translation: Emerging from the abode of consciousness, he enters the abode of nothingness.

source_sentence: 出無所有處，入於非想非非想處。
translation: Emerging from the sphere of nothingness, he enters the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

source_sentence: 出於非想非非想處，入滅盡定。
translation: Emerging from the abode of neither perception nor non-perception, he enters the concentration of total cessation.

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難既見如來湛然不言，身體肢節不復動搖，即便流淚而作是言：「世尊今已入般涅槃。」
translation: At the time, Ānanda saw that the Tathāgata was calm and silent, and that his body limbs didn't move anymore, so even with tears streaming down his face, he said, "The Bhagavān has now entered parinirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 爾時，阿[少/兔]樓駄語阿難言：「如來即時未般涅槃，所以湛然身不動者，正是入於滅盡定耳。」
translation: At that point, Anan was told by [Shao/Hare] Aniruddha, "The Tathāgata has not yet entered parinirvāṇa, so he's just entered the concentration of total cessation because he's so calm and still."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊出滅盡定，更還入於非想非非想處，乃至次第入於初禪。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān emerged from the concentration of total cessation and went back into the abode of neither perception nor non-perception, and he entered the first dhyāna in turn.

source_sentence: 復出初禪，入第二禪。
translation: He then emerged from the first dhyāna and entered the second dhyāna.

source_sentence: 出於二禪，入第三禪。
translation: He exited the second dhyāna and entered the third dhyāna.

source_sentence: 出於三禪，入第四禪，即於此地入般涅槃。
translation: He exits the third dhyāna and enters the fourth dhyāna, where he enters parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 爾時，阿[少/兔]樓駄語阿難言：「世尊已於第四禪地入般涅槃。」
translation: At the time, Alasdair said to Ānanda, "The Bhagavān has already entered parinirvāṇa in the fourth dhyāna."

source_sentence: 於是，阿難及四部眾，聞阿[少/兔]樓駄作此言已，悲號嗚咽，悶絕躃地。
translation: After hearing this from Ānanda and the four members of his group, they cried out in pity and sobbed, and fell to the ground in tears.

source_sentence: 其中或有舉手拍頭搥胸大叫，共相謂言：「世間眼滅，一何速哉！
translation: Some of them raised their hands, slapped their heads, and pounded their chests, shouting together, "How quickly does the eye of the world cease!

source_sentence: 一切眾生，從今已去，誰為導者？
translation: Who will be the guide of all sentient beings from now until the end of time?

source_sentence: 人天方減，惡道日增。」
translation: Only when humans and gods are diminished does the evil destinies increase day by day."

source_sentence: 時，虛空中天龍八部，涕泣滂沱猶如驟雨，互相謂言：「我等從今誰為歸依？
translation: At the time, the eight groups of gods and dragons in the sky were weeping and wailing like a downpour, saying to each other, "Who will be our refuge from now on?

source_sentence: 猶若嬰兒失於慈母。
translation: They're like a baby who's lost its loving mother.

source_sentence: 三惡道逕日就開闊，解脫之門方巨重關。
translation: The three evil destinies open up every day, and the gate of liberation is a huge, heavy barrier.

source_sentence: 一切眾生，沈淪苦海。
translation: All sentient beings are submerged in the ocean of suffering.

source_sentence: 亦如病人遠於良醫，又似盲者失所牽導。
translation: They're like a sick person who's far from a good doctor, or a blind person who's been left without a guide.

source_sentence: 我等既去無上法王，煩惱之賊日見侵逼。」
translation: Since we've left the unsurpassed Dharma king, the thieves of affliction are increasingly encumbering us."

source_sentence: 唱此言已，悶絕懊惱不能自禁。
translation: After he said those words, he was overcome with sorrow and distress, and he couldn't stop himself.

source_sentence: 時，鳩尸那城諸力士眾，皆悉勇健，猶如香象。
translation: The crowds of warriors in Kuśinagara were all as brave and robust as perfumed elephants.

source_sentence: 既見如來入般涅槃，神情憔悴，如病新起。
translation: When they saw the Tathāgata enter parinirvāṇa, they looked as emaciated as if they had just risen from illness.

source_sentence: 當於爾時大地震動天鼓自鳴，四大海水波浪翻倒，須彌山王自然傾搖，狂風奮發，林木摧折簫索枯悴，駭異於常。
translation: At the time, a great earthquake shook the celestial drums, the four great waters overturned, Mount Sumeru naturally shook, and a fierce wind raged, breaking down the trees and withering the cords, which was shockingly different from normal.

source_sentence: 爾時，大梵天王即說偈言：「過去與未來，　　及以今現在，　無有諸眾生，　　不歸無常者。
translation: At that point, the king of the Brahma gods spoke a verse, saying, "In the past, future, and present, there are no sentient beings who don't return to impermanence.

source_sentence: 如來天人尊，　　金剛身堅固，　猶不免無常，　　而況於餘人。
translation: Even though the Tathāgata is a god and a human being, with a strong adamantine body, he's not exempt from impermanence, so why wouldn't he be for others?

source_sentence: 一切諸眾生，　　愛惜保其身，　薰餘以香華，　　不知當毀滅。
translation: All sentient beings cherish and protect their bodies, and they perfume them with flowers and incense, not knowing that they will perish.

source_sentence: 如來金色身，　　相好以莊嚴，　會亦當棄捨，　　應入般涅槃。
translation: The Tathāgata's golden body, adorned by its good features, will be discarded and will enter parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 永斷諸煩惱，　　成一切種智，　猶尚不得免，　　況餘結累者。」
translation: He'll permanently end the afflictions and achieve omniscience, but he still won't be spared, so why wouldn't he be saddled with other bonds?"

source_sentence: 爾時，天帝釋即說偈言：「一切諸行性，　　實是生滅法，　兩足最勝尊，　　亦復歸於盡。
translation: At that point, Śakra then spoke a verse, saying, "The nature of all conditioned things is really the law of arising and ceasing, and the two-legged most honored one also comes to an end.

source_sentence: 三毒熾然火，　　恒燒諸眾生，　無有大悲雲，　　誰能雨令滅？」
translation: The three poisons are blazing hot and constantly burning sentient beings, and there's no cloud of great compassion, so who can rain down and make it go out?"

source_sentence: 爾時，阿[少/兔]樓駄，即說偈言：「如來於今日，　　諸根不搖動，　心意會諸法，　　而棄於此身。
translation: At that point, A[sha/rabbit] Dadana spoke a verse, saying, "Today, the Tathāgata's faculties don't budge, his mind meets qualities, and he abandons this body.

source_sentence: 恬然絕思慮，　　亦復無諸受，　如燈盡光滅，　　如來滅亦然。」
translation: He has calmly stopped thinking, and there are no feelings, just as a lamp's light goes out, so does the Tathāgata's cessation."

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難即說偈言：「大地忽震動，　　狂風四激起，　海水波翻倒，　　須彌寶山搖。
translation: It was then that Ānanda spoke the verse, "The earth suddenly trembles, a fierce wind rises in all directions, the ocean tumbles over, and Sumeru's precious mountain shakes.

source_sentence: 天人心悲痛，　　泣淚猶如雨，　皆悉大恐怖，　　如被非人執。
translation: The gods' hearts are saddened, weeping like rain, and they're all greatly afraid, like being held by inhumans.

source_sentence: 由佛般涅槃，　　故有如此事。」
translation: This happened because of the Buddha's parinirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 爾時，眾中有未得道比丘、人天，既見如來已般涅槃，心生懊惱，宛轉于地。
translation: At the time, there were monks, humans, and gods among the multitude who hadn't yet attained the Way and who, seeing that the Tathāgata had already gone into parinirvāṇa, were so distressed that they just turned to the ground.

source_sentence: 已得道者，深歎世間無常之苦，悲號啼泣不能自勝。
translation: Those who have already attained the Way profoundly lament the suffering of the world's impermanence, and they lament and weep uncontrollably.

source_sentence: 是時，阿[少/兔]樓駄語諸比丘及以天人：「汝等不應生大憂惱，如來前已為汝等說，諸行性相法皆如是。
translation: A[little/rabbit] then addressed the monks and gods, "You shouldn't be greatly distressed, for the Tathāgata has already explained to you that the nature and characteristics of conditioned things are likewise.

source_sentence: 云何猶故而悲泣耶？」
translation: Why is it that you're still sad and weeping?"

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難即便普語四遠來眾：「如來今已入般涅槃。」
translation: At that point, Ānanda even universally told the crowd of four people from far away, "The Tathāgata has now entered parinirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 爾時，眾人聞阿難言，悲號啼泣悶絕懊惱，而以微聲語阿難言：「今此人眾極為闐塞，三十二喻闍那，皆悉充滿。
translation: Hearing what Ānanda said, the crowd lamented, wept, became distressed, and spoke to Ānanda in a whisper, saying, "Now, this crowd of people is so full of tantalizers that the thirty-two metaphors are filled with jhāna.

source_sentence: 唯願尊者，各令我等次第得前親見如來，最後瞻仰禮拜供養。
translation: Please let the Bhagavān allow us to see the Tathāgata in person in order, and then finally venerate, worship, and make offerings to him.

source_sentence: 如來出世難可值遇，如優曇鉢華時時乃現，今者親在此般涅槃，願必哀愍，令我得見。」
translation: The Tathāgata's appearance in the world is difficult to encounter, like the udumbara flower that appears from time to time, and now that he's personally here in parinirvāṇa, may you have mercy on me and allow me to see him."

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難聞眾人言，心自思惟：「如來出世，極為難值，最後供養亦復甚難，我今當令誰在於先供養佛者？
translation: It was then that Ānanda heard what the crowd said and thought to himself, "The Tathāgata's appearance in the world is extremely difficult to encounter, and making offerings at the end is also very difficult, so who will I allow to make offerings to the Buddha at the beginning?

source_sentence: 今者宜使諸比丘尼及優婆夷，得在前來供養佛身。
translation: Now, it's appropriate for monks, nuns, and Upāsikās to come forward and make offerings to the Buddha's body.

source_sentence: 所以然者？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 斯等女弱，昔來之時，不必得到如來之所，以是因緣故宜在先。」
translation: These women are weak; in the past, they didn't have to go to the Tathāgata's place, so it's appropriate to go first because of this reason."

source_sentence: 作此念已，即便普唱：「諸比丘尼及優婆夷，皆聽前於如來身所。」
translation: After that thought, they even universally called out, "Monks, nuns, and Upāsikā, listen to the Tathāgata's body as they go forward."

source_sentence: 諸比丘尼及與無量優婆夷等，俱到佛所。
translation: The monks, nuns, and countless other Upāsikās all went to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 既見如來已般涅槃，啼泣懊惱，圍繞禮拜，種種供養。
translation: Seeing that the Tathāgata had already gone into parinirvāṇa, they lamented and were distressed, venerated around him, and made various offerings.

source_sentence: 爾時，有一貧窮優婆夷，年一百歲。
translation: At the time, there was a poor Upāsikā who was a hundred years old.

source_sentence: 見諸婆羅門，并及剎利長者居士、力士、妻女、長幼、大小，以妙香華種種供養，自傷貧乏獨絕此願，心自思惟：「如來出世極為難值，最後供養復為甚難，而今窮罄無以自表。」
translation: Seeing all the brāhmaṇas, elders, householders, warriors, wives, children, elders, and elders of the bhadra, making various offerings with wonderful incense and flowers, he was sad and poor and abandoned this vow alone, thinking to himself, "The Tathāgata's appearance in the world was extremely difficult to attain, and the final offering is even more difficult.

source_sentence: 作此念已，倍增悲慟，臨佛足上心大懊惱，涕泣流連汙如來足：「願我將來所生之處，常得見佛。」
translation: After that thought, he was doubly saddened and moved to the Buddha's feet with great distress, weeping and sobbing, he smeared the Tathāgata's feet, "May I always see the Buddha wherever I'm born in the future."

source_sentence: 諸比丘尼及優婆夷，供養畢已，即還本處。
translation: After they had made their offerings, the monks, nuns, and Upāsik returned to their original location.

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難又復普告諸餘人言：「諸比丘尼及優婆夷，供養已畢，汝等可前次第供養。」
translation: Ānanda then again addressed the others in general, saying, "After making offerings to the monks, nuns, and Upāsikā, you may go ahead and make offerings in order."

source_sentence: 時，諸人眾以次而來，到佛身所，既見如來已般涅槃，號泣宛轉心大悲惱，以諸供具而用供養。
translation: The people then came in order and went to the Buddha's body, and when they saw that the Tathāgata had already gone into parinirvāṇa, they wept and wavered with great pity and distress, making offerings with all the implements they had.

source_sentence: 爾時，諸力士眾皆悉集聚，共相謂言：「我等今者，云何闍維如來之身？
translation: At that point, the multitude of warriors all gathered together and said, "Now, how do we maintain the Tathāgata's body?

source_sentence: 世尊臨欲般涅槃時，應有遺勅。」
translation: When the Bhagavān is about to [enter] parinirvāṇa, he should leave this message behind."

source_sentence: 即便共往，問阿難言：「我等今者欲共闍維如來之身，其法云何？
translation: They both went there and asked Ānanda, "Now, we'd like to work together to preserve the Tathāgata's body, but what's the teaching?

source_sentence: 世尊臨可般涅槃時，當有遺旨，唯願見告。」
translation: When the Bhagavān is about to approach parinirvāṇa, he will have a message to leave behind that I wish to share with you."

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難語力士言：「如來遺勅闍維之法，令與轉輪聖王等無有異。」
translation: It was then that Ānanda told the strong man, "The Tathāgata will leave behind this teaching for Jāvi, so that it won't be any different from that of the wheel-turning sage kings and so forth."

source_sentence: 阿難即便具說佛向所勅之事。
translation: Ānanda then explained exactly what the Buddha had commanded him to do.

source_sentence: 諸力士等聞阿難言，皆共嚴辦闍維之具。
translation: When the strong men and others heard what Ānanda told them, they all decorated the jhāpita's equipment.

source_sentence: 先造寶輿雕鏤莊麗，以如來身置寶輿上，燒香散華。
translation: First, they built a jeweled mantle, decorated it with carvings, placed the Tathāgata's body on it, burned incense, and scattered flowers.

source_sentence: 作眾伎樂，歌頌讚歎。
translation: They created a multitude of musical performances, singing and praising him.

source_sentence: 於音樂中，而說苦空無常無我不淨之法。
translation: Amidst the music, they taught the teaching of suffering, emptiness, impermanence, selflessness, and impurity.

source_sentence: 時，諸力士白阿難言：「如來今者既般涅槃，最後供養極為難遇，我等請留如來之身，七日七夜恣意供養，令諸天人長夜獲安。」
translation: The warriors then said to Ānanda, "Now that the Tathāgata is in parinirvāṇa and his final offerings are extremely difficult to come by, we'd like to keep the Tathāgata's body for seven days and nights to make offerings at will, so that the gods and humans can be comfortable for a long time."

source_sentence: 阿難即便以力士言問阿[少/兔]樓駄，阿[少/兔]樓駄答阿難言：「善哉！
translation: Even then, Ānanda asked A[lesser/rabbit] Lupin about it with the words of a strong man, and A[lesser/rabbit] Lupin answered Ānanda, "Good!

source_sentence: 隨意。」
translation: As you like."

source_sentence: 阿難爾時告諸力士：「聽留佛身七日七夜恣意供養。」
translation: It was then that Ānanda told the warriors, "Listen and keep the Buddha's body for seven days and nights to make offerings at will."

source_sentence: 時，諸力士聞阿難言，心大悲慶，即於林中種種供養，滿七日已。
translation: When the strong men heard what Ānanda said, their hearts were so compassionate and joyous that they made various offerings in the forest for seven full days.

source_sentence: 時，諸力士以新淨綿及以細[疊*毛]纏如來身，然後內以金棺之中，其金棺內散以牛頭栴檀、香屑及諸妙華，即以金棺內銀棺中，又以銀棺內銅棺中，又以銅棺內鐵棺中，又以鐵棺置寶輿上，作諸伎樂歌唄讚歎。
translation: The warriors then wrapped a fresh, pure cotton and fine [pile*hair] around the Tathāgata's body, placed it inside a gold coffin, scattered cow-head sandalwood, scraps of incense, and other marvelous flowers inside the gold coffin, placed a silver coffin inside the gold coffin, a copper coffin inside the silver coffin, an iron coffin inside the copper coffin, and placed the iron coffin on a jeweled mantle, making music, singing, and praising it.

source_sentence: 諸天於空，散曼陀羅花、摩訶曼陀羅花、曼殊沙花、摩訶曼殊沙花，并作天樂，種種供養，然後次第下諸棺蓋。
translation: In the sky, the gods scattered flowers of mandāra, mahāmandāra, mahāmañjūṣaka, and mahāmañjūṣaka, making celestial music and various offerings, and then lowered the lids of the coffins in turn.

source_sentence: 時，力士等共相謂言：「七日之期今者已滿，我等宜應舁如來棺，周匝繞城，令諸人民恣意供養，然後往於城南闍維。」
translation: The strong men then said to each other, "Now that the seven-day period has ended, we should carry the Tathāgata's coffin around the city, make offerings to the people as we please, and then go south to Jhāpita."

source_sentence: 作此言已，即便共舁如來之棺，盡其身力而不能起，各共驚怪不知何故？
translation: After they said that, they then lifted the Tathāgata's coffin together, but they were all surprised and didn't know why they couldn't lift it up despite their physical strength.

source_sentence: 而以問於阿[少/兔]樓駄：「我等諸人欲舁佛棺，周匝繞城。
translation: They then asked A[sha/rabbit] Dadana, "We people wanted to carry the Buddha's coffin all the way around the city.

source_sentence: 還趣南門供養闍維，盡竭身力而不能舉，不知此是何等事相？
translation: We went back to the south gate to pay our respects to Jālinī, but we exhausted our strength and couldn't lift it.

source_sentence: 唯願尊者為我說之。」
translation: Please, Your Holiness, explain this for me."

source_sentence: 時，阿[少/兔]樓駄語眾人言：「所以然者，虛空諸天欲令佛棺周匝繞城。
translation: A[less/rabbit] then told the crowd, "That's why the gods of space wanted to make the Buddha's coffin go around the city.

source_sentence: 從北門入住於城中，聽諸天人種種供養。
translation: From the northern gate, they entered the city and listened to the various offerings from the gods and people.

source_sentence: 然後應從東門而出，往於寶冠支提之所，而闍維之。」
translation: Then they should leave through the east gate and go to the jeweled crown of Cedi and maintain it."

source_sentence: 彼諸力士聞此語已，共相謂言：「諸天意爾，宜應順從。」
translation: After those strong men heard those words, they all said to each other, "If the gods so desire, it's appropriate to obey them."

source_sentence: 即舁佛棺，繞城一匝，從北門入，住城之中，聽諸天人恣意供養，作妙伎樂，燒香散華，歌唄讚歎。
translation: They then carried the Buddha's coffin once around the city, entered through the northern gate, and stayed there while listening to the gods make offerings at will, create wonderful music, burn incense and scatter flowers, and sing praises.

source_sentence: 諸天於空，雨曼陀羅花、摩訶曼陀羅華、曼殊沙花、摩訶曼殊沙花，并作天樂，種種供養。
translation: In the sky, the gods rained down flowers of mandāra, mahāmandāra, manjusar, and mahāmajusar, making celestial music and offering various offerings.

source_sentence: 供養訖已，即便從城東門而出，往於寶冠支提之所。
translation: When the offerings were made, they left the city through the east gate and went to the jeweled crown of Cedi.

source_sentence: 既到彼處，比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷、天龍八部感結悲哽不能自勝，而便聚積牛頭栴檀及諸雜香。
translation: Once there, the monks, nuns, laymen, upāsaka, upāsikā, gods, dragons, and the eight groups of gods were overcome with compassion, and they gathered oxhead sandalwood and various other fragrances.

source_sentence: 又於[卄/積]上，敷舒繒[疊*毛]，施大寶帳以覆其上，舁舉寶棺，繞彼香[卄/積]周迴七匝，燒香散花，作眾伎樂，而以寶棺置香[卄/積]上，取妙香油周澆灑之。
translation: They spread a silken silken [pile*hair] on top of the [twenty/plume], covered it with a large precious tent, lifted the precious coffin, circled it seven times, burned incense and scattered flowers, performed numerous tricks, and placed the precious coffin on top of the [twenty/plume] and poured wonderful fragrant oil all over it.

source_sentence: 時，四部眾并諸天人，戀慕懊憹不能自勝，即便以火從下燒之。
translation: When that happens, the four groups of people and gods are overcome with longing and anxiety, so they burn it from below with fire.

source_sentence: 火不肯然乃至再三，亦復不然。
translation: The fire wouldn't accept it, and it didn't accept it again or again.

source_sentence: 時，諸人眾不知所以，即以此事問阿[少/兔]樓駄：「三燒香[卄/積]，何故不然？」
translation: Not knowing the reason, the people then asked A[sha/rabbit] Loudana about this, "Why isn't it burning incense [twenty/calendar] three times?"

source_sentence: 阿[少/兔]樓駄言：「所以然者，尊者摩訶迦葉在鐸叉那耆利國，聞於如來欲般涅槃，與五百比丘從彼國來，欲見世尊。
translation: Sendagiri said, "That's why, when the Venerable Mahākāśyapa was in the country of Takṣaṇagiri and heard that the Tathāgata was about to [enter] parinirvāṇa, he came from that country with five hundred monks who wanted to see the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 是以如來不令火然。」
translation: That's why the Tathāgata didn't make the fire burn."

source_sentence: 爾時，大眾聞此語已，深歎奇特。
translation: After hearing this, the crowd deeply admired and wondered at it.

source_sentence: 爾時，摩訶迦葉在鐸叉那耆利國，遙聞如來在鳩尸那城，欲般涅槃，心大悲戀，與五百比丘緣路而來。
translation: At the time, Mahākāśyapa was in the country of Takṣaṇa Jīvaka and heard from afar that the Tathāgata was in the city of Kauśinagara, wishing to attain parinirvāṇa, and he was so moved by compassion that he came with five hundred monks by way of the road.

source_sentence: 去城不遠，身患疲極在於路邊，與諸比丘坐於樹下。
translation: Not far from the city, he was overcome by physical exhaustion and was sitting under a tree with the monks.

source_sentence: 見一外道，手執曼陀羅華，迦葉問言：「汝從何來？」
translation: Seeing a layman holding a mandāra flower in his hand, Kāśyapa asked, "Where did you come from?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我從鳩尸那城來。」
translation: He replied, "I've come from the city of Kauśinagara."

source_sentence: 迦葉又問：「汝知我師應正遍知不？」
translation: Kāśyapa also asked, "Do you know that my teacher is omniscient?"

source_sentence: 其即答言：「識。
translation: He then replied, "I see.

source_sentence: 汝大師在鳩尸那城娑羅林中雙樹之間，已般涅槃，得今七日。
translation: Your teacher was in parinirvāṇa between two trees in the Sālêndra forest of Kuśinagara city when he attained parinirvāṇa seven days ago.

source_sentence: 即時正在寶冠支提，將欲闍維，天人充滿，互競供養故，我於彼得此天華。」
translation: Now, he's at Jewel Crowned Cedi, about to ascend to Jhāpita, filled with gods and humans who compete for offerings, and here I am, Peter, with this celestial flower."

source_sentence: 爾時，迦葉聞此言已，悲號哽咽，諸比丘眾悶絕躃地，而以微聲共相謂言：「嗚呼！
translation: After hearing these words, Kāśyapa was overcome with lamentation, and the monks fell to the ground in despair, saying together with a small voice, "Whoops!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 世間眼滅。」
translation: The eye of the world ceases."

source_sentence: 於是迦葉而安慰之：「汝等不應作此苦憹，諸行性相皆悉如是。
translation: Kāśyapa then reassured him, "You shouldn't be so anxious about suffering; the nature and characteristics of all conditioned things are just like that.

source_sentence: 如來天尊猶尚不免，況復餘人而得脫耶？
translation: How could anyone else be liberated when the Tathāgata gods are still not spared?

source_sentence: 宜應精進求離世苦，今可速起前於寶冠支提之所禮拜瞻仰。」
translation: You should make effort to escape worldly suffering, so now you can quickly get up and venerate him at the jeweled crown of Cedi."

source_sentence: 爾時，眾中有餘比丘，晚暮出家愚癡無智，共相謂言：「佛在世時，禁呵我等，不得縱意。
translation: At the time, there were some other monks in the congregation who had left home late in the evening, were foolish and had no wisdom, and they all said to each other, "When the Buddha was alive, he forbade us from taking liberties with him.

source_sentence: 既般涅槃，何其快哉！」
translation: Now that we're in parinirvāṇa, how pleasant it is!"

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉與諸比丘，進鳩尸那城，到於寶冠支提之所，見如來棺，在香[卄/積]上，悲泣流淚圍繞七匝，而登香[卄/積]。
translation: Kāśyapa and the monks then entered the city of Kuśinagara and went to the jeweled crown of Cedi, saw the Tathāgata's coffin on the [twenty/plume of] incense, and surrounded it seven times with tears and sorrow as they ascended to the [twenty/plume of] incense.

source_sentence: 至寶棺所，在於足處號咷嗚咽，頭面作禮。
translation: When he arrived at the coffin, he stood at his feet, cried out, and bowed with his head in front of him.

source_sentence: 爾時，如來於寶棺內，而出雙足，迦葉見此，倍增悲驚。
translation: At that point, the Tathāgata emerged from inside the jeweled coffin with his feet up, and Kāśyapa was doubly shocked when he saw this.

source_sentence: 時，諸天人既覩奇特希有之事，莫不嗟歎，深生苦戀。
translation: When the gods and humans saw this strange and wonderful thing, they all sighed in admiration and felt a deep, bitter longing for it.

source_sentence: 爾時，迦葉見佛足上而有點汙，即便迴顧，問阿難言：「如來足上何緣有此？」
translation: Seeing the dirt on the Buddha's feet, Kāśyapa even looked back and asked Ānanda, "What is the reason there's this on the Tathāgata's feet?"

source_sentence: 阿難答言：「如來初可般涅槃時，四眾充滿，我時思惟：『若令大眾同時進者，女人羸弱，不必得前。』
translation: Ānanda answered, "When the Tathāgata first attained parinirvāṇa and the four crowds were filled, I thought, 'If I were to allow the masses to advance at the same time, a woman who's weak wouldn't have to go before me.'

source_sentence: 即便先聽諸比丘尼及優婆夷到如來所禮拜供養。
translation: He then first listened to the monks, nuns, and upāsikās go to the Tathāgata to pay their respects and make offerings.

source_sentence: 爾時，有一貧窮優婆夷，年一百歲。
translation: At the time, there was a poor Upāsikā who was a hundred years old.

source_sentence: 見諸婆羅門，及以剎利長者居士，力士妻女，長幼大小，以妙香華種種供養，自傷貧乏無以表心，作此念已，倍增悲慟，臨佛足上，心大懊憹，涕泣流連，汙如來足。」
translation: Seeing all the brāhmaṇas, elders and householders of the bhadra, wives and daughters of warriors, young and old, making various offerings with wonderful incense and flowers, and feeling sorry for himself and his lack of means, he was doubly saddened by this thought, and when he approached the Buddha's feet, his heart was greatly distressed, and he wept and smeared the Tathāgata's feet."

source_sentence: 爾時，迦葉既聞此語，心懷惆悵，怪責阿難曾不呵止致此點汙，即以香華，供養佛棺，禮拜讚歎。
translation: After hearing these words, Kāśyapa was distressed and blamed Ānanda for not calming him down and causing this little defilement, so he offered incense and flowers to the Buddha's coffin, paid homage, and praised him.

source_sentence: 皆悉畢已，於是雙足自然還入，迦葉即便還下於地。
translation: After they had all finished, he then naturally returned with both feet, and Kāśyapa even went back down to the ground.

source_sentence: 以佛力故香[卄/積]自然，四面火起，經歷七日，寶棺融盡。
translation: Because of the Buddha's power, the fragrance [20/accumulation] naturally spread, and a fire started on all sides.

source_sentence: 於時諸天，雨火令滅，諸力士眾收取舍利。
translation: The gods then made the fire go out with rain, and a multitude of strong men collected the relics.

source_sentence: 以千張[疊*毛]纏佛身者，最裏一張及外一重，如本不然，猶裹舍利。
translation: Of the thousand [heaped*hair] sheets that had been wrapped around the Buddha's body, the innermost sheet and one outer sheet were otherwise wrapped around the relics.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，虛空諸天雨眾妙華，并作伎樂，歌唄讚歎，供養舍利。
translation: At the time, the gods of the sky rained down a profusion of marvelous flowers and created music, singing, praising, and offering sacrificial offerings to the relic.

source_sentence: 時，諸來眾及以力士，皆悉各設種種供養。
translation: The multitude of visitors and the strong men then each made various offerings.

source_sentence: 諸力士眾，即以金甖收取舍利，置寶輿上，燒香散華，作眾伎樂，還歸入城。
translation: The strong men then gathered the relics in a golden bowl, placed them on a jeweled bier, burned incense, scattered flowers, made lots of music, and returned them to the city.

source_sentence: 起大高樓而以舍利置於樓上，即嚴四兵，防衛守護。
translation: They raised a large, high building and placed the relics on it, and then they decorated it with four armies to guard it.

source_sentence: 唯聽比丘及比丘尼，得入禮拜，種種供養。
translation: Only monks and nuns were allowed to enter, venerate, and make various offerings.

source_sentence: 其餘國王及婆羅門，長者居士，一切人民，皆不聽前。
translation: The other kings, priests, elders, householders, and all the people wouldn't listen to them.

source_sentence: 爾時，韋提希子阿闍世王，聞彼力士收佛舍利，置高樓上，而嚴四兵防衛守護，心大悲惱，又復忿怒諸力士輩，即便遣信，語力士言：「世尊在世，亦是我師。
translation: When King Vaidehīputra Ajātaśatru heard that those strong men had taken the Buddha's relics, placed them on a high building, and had decorated them with four soldiers to guard and protect them, he was greatly saddened and angered by the group of strong men.

source_sentence: 般涅槃時，恨不臨見，我之族姓，及與世尊，皆是剎利，汝今云何，獨收舍利，置高樓上，而嚴四兵防衛守護，不分餘人？
translation: At the time of parinirvāṇa, I hated that I wasn't about to see that my clan and the Bhagavān were all buddhas, so why did you take the relics alone, put them on a high building, and decorate them with four soldiers to guard and protect them without sharing them with anyone else?

source_sentence: 汝便可以一分與我，我欲於國起妙兜婆，興諸供養。
translation: Then you can give me a piece of it, and I want to raise a wonderful dhūpa in my country and make offerings to it.

source_sentence: 若能見許，永通國好；不見許者，興兵伐汝。」
translation: If you can see and approve, you'll be forever partaking of the goodness of the country; if you don't, I'll raise an army against you."

source_sentence: 餘七國王及毗耶離、諸離車等，遣使之法，皆亦如是。
translation: The other seven kings, Vaiśālī, Licchavi, and the others all sent their envoys in the same way.

source_sentence: 時，婆羅門、長者、居士亦各遣信，白力士言：「世尊亦是我等之師，願能哀愍，賜舍利分。」
translation: The brāhmaṇas, elders, and householders then each sent a message to the ministers, saying, "The Bhagavān is also our teacher; may he have compassion on us and grant us a share of Śāriputra."

source_sentence: 時，諸國使到力士所，具宣王意，力士聞已，深懷不平，答諸使言：「佛來我國而般涅槃，舍利自然應屬我等。
translation: When the country's envoys came to Rāṣṭrapāla and explained the king's wishes, Rāṣṭrapāla was deeply upset when he heard them and answered the envoys, "Since the Buddha came to our country and passed away, the relics should naturally belong to us.

source_sentence: 欲於國界興造兜婆莊嚴供養，此不可得。
translation: If we want to build a shrine at the border of our country, we can't possibly make offerings to it.

source_sentence: 若兜婆成，恣汝等意，快共來此供養禮拜，若欲興兵，而見向者，此國軍眾，亦足相擬。」
translation: If you wish to raise an army and see it approaching, the army of this country would be sufficient for that purpose."

source_sentence: 時，彼諸使各歸本國，人人向王說如此事。
translation: Each of those envoys then returned to his own country, and each of them told the king about this.

source_sentence: 諸王聞已，益懷瞋忿，各嚴四兵而往攻伐。
translation: When the kings heard this, their anger grew, and they each decorated four armies and went to attack.

source_sentence: 時，諸力士亦嚴戰具，以擬來敵。
translation: The warriors then also adorned their battle gear in preparation for the coming enemy.

source_sentence: 鳩尸那城中，有一婆羅門，名徒盧那，聰明多智，深信三寶。
translation: In the city of Kuśinagara, there was a Brāhmaṇa named Tuluna who was brilliant and had great wisdom and believed deeply in the Three Treasures.

source_sentence: 心自思惟：「彼八國王及諸離車，身力壯健，軍眾精銳。
translation: He thought to himself, "Those eight kingdoms and their chariots are physically strong and their armies are elite.

source_sentence: 又且力士勇猛難當，若交戰者必無兩全。」
translation: Moreover, those strong men are formidable and difficult to deal with; if we were to engage them in battle, there would be no chance that they would be defeated."

source_sentence: 而即便語諸力士言：「汝等雖復勇銳果敢，彼八國王，齊力同心，人眾雲集，軍陣猛盛，若戰鬪者，理無兩全，鋒刃既交，必有傷害。
translation: Even so, he said to the strong men, "Although you may be brave and bold, those eight kings are united in strength, their men are numerous, and their armies are fierce; if we fight, there's no way we'd be able to save them both, and when blades meet, there's bound to be injury.

source_sentence: 如來在世，教人行慈，而於今日，忽相殺戮，汝等不應悋惜舍利，宜分諸國及離車等，各於其界，造立兜婆。
translation: Since the Tathāgata taught people to be compassionate while he was alive and now they're suddenly killing each other, you shouldn't treasure the relics, so you should divide up the countries and chariots and create a turuṣka in their own territory.

source_sentence: 稱於世尊往昔之訓，又使汝等普獲福利。」
translation: This will praise the Bhagavān's past teaching and bring welfare to all of you."

source_sentence: 諸力士眾，聞此語已，心意解悟，即答之言：「汝之所說，實得於理，聽如汝言。」
translation: After hearing those words, the soldiers' minds were enlightened, and they replied, "What you've said is really true, and I've heard it just as you said."

source_sentence: 彼婆羅門，見力士眾皆悉解甲，即便出城，語諸王言：「汝今為法何故興兵？」
translation: Seeing the multitude of strong men all relieved of their armor, the Brāhmaṇa went out of the city and said to the kings, "Why are you raising an army because of the teaching?"

source_sentence: 諸王答言：「我為法故，遠求舍利，而見拒逆，不肯分與，是以今者興兵共來。」
translation: The kings answered, "I've sought the relics from afar for the sake of the Dharma, but when I saw the resistance, I wouldn't share them with them; that's why I've raised an army to come with you."

source_sentence: 時，婆羅門復語王言：「我已相為和諸力士，皆悉與汝舍利之分，可取寶瓶，為汝分之。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇa then again said to the king, "I've already given you a share of the relics from each of the warriors, so take this precious vial and divide it up for you."

source_sentence: 八王歡喜，奉授金瓶。
translation: The eight kings rejoiced and gave the golden vials.

source_sentence: 彼婆羅門，受諸金瓶，持以還歸，於高樓上而分舍利，以與八王。
translation: The brāhmaṇa accepted the gold vials, returned with them, and distributed the relics up on a high building to the eight kings.

source_sentence: 于時，八王既得舍利，踴躍頂戴，還於本國各起兜婆。
translation: After receiving the relics, the eight kings jumped up and put their heads on their shoulders and returned to their home countries to each raise a stūpa.

source_sentence: 彼婆羅門從諸力士，乞分舍利瓶，自起兜婆。
translation: The Brāhmaṇa asked the strong men to share the vial of relics with him and raised a stūpa of his own.

source_sentence: 諸力士等取其一分，於闍維處，合餘灰炭而起兜婆；如是凡起十處兜婆。
translation: The strong men took a portion of it, combined it with the rest of the ashes and coals, and raised a tuṣita; thus, they raised tuṣita in ten places.

source_sentence: 如來從始欲般涅槃，及般涅槃後至於闍維，起諸兜婆，其事如是。
translation: The Tathāgata did so from the beginning, when he wanted to attain parinirvāṇa, to the jhāpita after parinirvāṇa, when he raised all these stūpas.

source_sentence: 其後迦葉共於阿難及諸比丘，於王舍城，結集三藏。
translation: Later, Kāśyapa, Ānanda, and the monks assembled the Tripiṭaka in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 大般涅槃經卷下
translation: Mahāparinirvāṇa Sutra, Volume 2
